content.question: In the circuit shown above, <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is a variable resistor. What resistance must <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> have so that the voltage across the <math alttext="1000 ohm" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>1000</mtext><mo>⁢</mo><mtext> </mtext><mtext>Ω</mtext><mtext> </mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> resistor is <math alttext="5.0 volts" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>5.0 V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
